page.title: 07Tockwith Parish Council
page.content: The{Parish Council}comprises 10 councillors elected every 4 years,to look after the interests of the community. Any resident can stand for election. The{Parish Council}meets every 6 weeks. Anyone can attend, but must not speak until invited by the chairman. Twice a year newsletters are sent out to inform the public of village events, and sometimes to ask for opinions and support. In the newsletter of February 1985 the major issues included:- 1. Discussion of a planning document proposing further housing development. 2. The disposal of household waste. 3. A deficit in the annual rates. 4. The fouling of pathways by dogs. 5. The format of future{Parish {Council}meetings.
